algorithm:
New algorithm description: The modified algorithm, named Algorithm Z, calculates the scores for the bins by taking the sum of the remainign capacity of each bin, multiplying it by the logarithm of the item size raised to the power of 3, subtracting the square root of the sum of the bin capacities from the product, then multiplying by an increasing geometric sequence of weights raised to the power of 3, and finally taking the maximum score across all bins prior to returning the scores.

Python implementation of the new algorithm:

```
code:
import numpy as np

def score(item: int, bins: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    """The Modified Score Algorithm Z calculates the scores for the bins by taking the sum of the remaining capacity of each bin, multiplying it by the logarithm of the item size raised to the power of 3, subtracting the square root of the sum of the bin capacities from the product, then multiplying by an increasing geometric sequence of weights raised to the power of 3, and finally taking the maximum score across all bins."""

    # Calculate the remaining capacity of each bin
    remaining_capacity = bins - item
    
    # Calculate the sum of the remaining capacity of each bin
    sum_remaining_capacity = np.sum(remaining_capacity)
    
    # Calculate the logarithm of the item size raised to the power of 3
    log_item_cube = np.log(item) ** 3
    
    # Calculate the product of the sum of the remaining capacity and the logarithm of the item size raised to the power of 3
    product = sum_remaining_capacity * log_item_cube
    
    # Calculate the square root of the sum of the bin capacities
    sqrt_sum = np.sqrt(np.sum(bins))
    
    # Subtract the square root of the sum of the bin capacities from the product
    scores = product - sqrt_sum
    
    # Calculate the increasing geometric sequence of weights raised to the power of 3
    weights_powered = np.power(np.arange(1, len(bins)+1), 3)
    
    # Multiply the scores by the increasing geometric sequence of weights raised to the power of 3
    scores *= weights_powered
    
    # Take the maximum score across all bins
    max_score = np.max(scores)
    
    return scores
